intro: Tipularia kyushuensis, commonly known as the Kyushu tipularia, is a small, herbaceous plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest floors or along stream banks. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a slightly hairy surface. Tipularia kyushuensis is of interest to botanists due to its limited distribution and unique ecological adaptations.
